title: Indian Army Chief's Band
text:
The Indian Army Chief's Band is the <a href="Indian%20Army">Indian Army</a>'s full-time music band. It was founded in 1990 as the official band of the <a href="Indian%20Army">Indian Army</a> and the foremost in the armed forces. It also, as its name implies, represents the <a href="Chief%20of%20the%20Army%20Staff%20%28India%29">Chief of the Army Staff</a> at events involving the COAS's presence. The band represents India in most important state events held in the Indian capital. It was raised in 1990 with bandsmen being drawn multiple <a href="Indian%20military%20bands">Indian military bands</a> in order to "retain the true representation of the entire nation in one band". In April 2011, a string section was added, consisting of <a href="cello">cello</a>s, <a href="viola">viola</a>s and <a href="violins">violins</a>, elevating it to a symphony orchestra comprising 72 musicians. Outside of the <a href="Indian%20Army">Indian Army</a>, it has also represented the <a href="India">India</a>n nation at various military music festivals in <a href="France">France</a>, <a href="Italy">Italy</a>, <a href="Sweden">Sweden</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>, <a href="Great%20Britain">Great Britain</a>, <a href="Russia">Russia</a> and <a href="Bangladesh">Bangladesh</a>.
Structure.
The band consists of the following ensembles:
Initially, the band played with percussion, brass and woodwind sections. Today, the band uses traditional Indian instruments such as the <a href="Mridangam">Mridangam</a>, the <a href="Tabla">Tabla</a>, and the <a href="Carnatic%20music">Carnatic</a>. In addition other traditional instruments such as the <a href="Santoor">Santoor</a>, <a href="Sitar">Sitar</a> and <a href="Jaltarang">Jaltarang</a> have been incorporated in the band.
Events.
The band performs at ceremonial events with the Indian Army, including the <a href="Presentation%20of%20Colours">Presentation of Colours</a> and the annual <a href="Delhi%20Republic%20Day%20parade">Delhi Republic Day parade</a> on the <a href="Rajpath">Rajpath</a>. In the latter, the band is not a marching contingent but rather is located away from the road in an area near the national flag during which it performs "<a href="Jana%20Gana%20Mana">Jana Gana Mana</a>" the presentation of honours by the <a href="President%27s%20Bodyguard">President's Bodyguard</a>. It also performs at <a href="state%20dinner">state dinner</a>s held at the <a href="Rashtrapati%20Bhavan">Rashtrapati Bhavan</a>, hosted by the <a href="President%20of%20India">President of India</a> for a foreign <a href="head%20of%20state">head of state</a>. It also performs at community events in its vicinity.
